bookName: The Book on the Two Eids
babName: [What Has Been Related] About Walking On The Day Of Eid
hadithText: Ali bin Abi Talib narrated: "It is from the SUnnah to leave for the Eid walking, and to eat something before leaving."

bookName: The Book on the Two Eids
babName: [What Has Been Related] About The Eid Prayers Before The Khutbah
hadithText: Ibn Umar narrated: "Allah's Messenger, Abu Bakr, and Umar would pray during the two Eid before the Khutbah, then they would give the Khutbah."

bookName: The Book on the Two Eids
babName: [What Has Been Related] About The Salat For The Two Eid Is Without An Adhan Nor An Iqamah
hadithText: Jabir bin Samurah narrated: "I prayed the two Eid prayers with the Prophet - not one time, not two times - without and Adhan nor an Iqamah."

bookName: The Book on the Two Eids
babName: [What Has Been Related About About] The Recitation During The Two Eid
hadithText: An-Numan bin Bashir narrated: "For the two Eid and the Friday prayer, the Prophet would recite: Glorify the Name of your Lord, the Most High, and Has there come to you the narration of the overwhelming? And sometimes they would occur on he same day, so he would recite the two of them."

bookName: The Book on the Two Eids
babName: [What Has Been Related About About] The Recitation During The Two Eid
hadithText: Ubaidullah bin Abdullah bin Utbah narrated: "Umar bin Al-Khattab asked Abu Waqid Al-Laithi what Allah's Messenger would recite during Al-Fitr and Al-Adha, so he said: 'He would recite: Qaf, By the Glorious Quran and the Hour has drawn near, and the moon has been cleft asunder.'"

bookName: The Book on the Two Eids
babName: [What Has Been Related About About] The Recitation During The Two Eid
hadithText: Ubaidullah bin Abdullah bin Utbah: There is a another chain with similar narration.

bookName: The Book on the Two Eids
babName: [What Has Been Related] About The Takbir On The Two Eid
hadithText: Kathir bin Abdullah narrated from this father, from his grandfather: "The Prophet said the Takbir in the first (Rak'ah) sever (times) before the recitation, and in the last, five (times) before the recitation."

bookName: The Book on the Two Eids
babName: What Has Been Related About 'There Is No Salat Before The Two Eid And No Salat After Them'
hadithText: Ibn Abbas narrated: "The Prophet went out on the day of Al-Fitr, so he prayed two Rak'ah, then he did not pray before it nor after it."

bookName: The Book on the Two Eids
babName: What Has Been Related About 'There Is No Salat Before The Two Eid And No Salat After Them'
hadithText: Abu Bakr bin Hafs - and he is Ibn Umar bin Sa'd bin Abi Waqas - narrated about Ibn Umar, that: "He went out on the day of Eid, and he did not pray before it nor after it. He mentioned that the Prophet did so."

bookName: The Book on the Two Eids
babName: About The Women Going Out For The Two Eid
hadithText: Umm Atiyyah narrated: "Allah's Messenger would order the virgins, the mature women, the secluded and the menstruating to go out for the two Eid. As for the menstruating women, they were to stay away from the Musalla and participate in the Muslims supplications." One of them said: 'O Messenger of Allah! What if she does not have a Jilbab? He said: 'Then let her sis lend her a Jilbab.'"

bookName: The Book on the Two Eids
babName: About The Women Going Out For The Two Eid
hadithText: There is a similar narration from Umm Atiyyah : with another chain.

bookName: The Book on the Two Eids
babName: What Has Been Related About the Prophet Going To The Eid By One Route, And Returning By Another
hadithText: Abu Hurairah narrated: "When Allah's Messenger would go out on the day of Eid by one route, he would return by another."

bookName: The Book on the Two Eids
babName: [What Has Been Related] About Eating On The Day Of Fitr Before Going Out
hadithText: Abdullah bin Buraidah narrated from his father: "The Prophet would not leave on the Day of Fitr until he ate, and he would not eat on the day of Adha until he prayed."

bookName: The Book on the Two Eids
babName: [What Has Been Related] About Eating On The Day Of Fitr Before Going Out
hadithText: Anas bin Malik narrated: "The Prophet would have a breakfast of dates on the Day of Fitr before leaving for the Musalla."
